<h2>Welcome ðŸ‘‹</h2>
<p> I am a PhD researcher in Mathematical Biology at Memorial University of Newfoundland, specializing in climate-driven models of mosquito population dynamics. My work integrates temperature, rainfall, and photoperiod to better understand vector ecology and inform targeted public health strategies. I am currently supervised by <a href="https://ahurford.github.io/website/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">Dr. Amy Hurford</a>. </p>
<p> I focus on deterministic and stochastic modeling, ecological systems analysis, and the translation of climate and ecological data into mathematical frameworks. I have expertise in R and LaTeX, working knowledge of Python and its scientific libraries, and experience in scientific computing with Git/GitHub and in macOS and Linux environments. </p>
<p> I also have experience teaching undergraduate mathematics and R programming, and mentoring students in research, data analysis, and scientific communication. </p>
<p> Learn more about my projects and findings in the <a href="/research.qmd">Research</a> section. </p> <hr> </div> </div>
